Your essay demonstrates a basic understanding of the topic, but there are several areas that could be improved.

Firstly, you mention that commercial satellites use better cameras, but you don't provide any explanation or evidence to support this claim. To address the first factor listed in the rubric (commercial satellites are more cost-effective), you could have provided examples of how commercial satellites are able to capture images at a lower cost than non-commercial satellites, such as through the use of multi-spectral imaging or the ability to capture large areas in a single pass.

Regarding the second factor (commercial satellites are better able to meet the timing needs of image capture), you could have discussed how commercial satellites typically have a shorter revisit time than non-commercial satellites, allowing for more frequent imaging and monitoring of agricultural areas. Additionally, you could have addressed the third factor (commercial satellites have better satellite resolution) by providing examples of how commercial satellites are able to capture images with higher spatial resolution than non-commercial satellites, which can be useful for precision agriculture applications.

Overall, your essay could benefit from more detailed and evidence-based arguments to support your claims about the advantages of using commercial satellite data in agriculture.

On the one hand, commercial satellites have better resolution than non-commercial satellites, which can provide farmers with clearer pictures of their fields. On the other hand, non-commercial satellites can also provide valuable data for agriculture.
